title: 56. The Navigator - Hurray for the Riff Raff
text: by thisistheeggman What happened to Alynda Segarra? This new material sounds like she's channeling Alainis Morissette. And not in a good way Biography Formed: 2007 in New Orleans, LA Genre: Alternative Years Active: '00s, '10s New Orleans-based indie folk outfit Hurray for the Riff Raff were formed by singer/songwriter/banjo player Alynda Lee, a Bronx-raised Puerto Rican troubadour who left home at 17 to ride the rails and eventually landed in the Big Easy. After honing her skills on the washboard with a gang of train-yard musicians called the Dead Man's Street Orchestra, she picked up the banjo that a close friend had given her and began writing her own songs. While Lee, drummer/violinist Yosi Pearlstein, and bass player... Top Albums and Songs by Hurray for the Riff Raff 1.
